Apple___Apple_scab.description: Fungal disease causing dark, scabby lesions on leaves, fruit, and twigs. Most common in cool, wet weather conditions.
symptoms: Dark, olive-green to black spots on leaves

immediate: Apply fungicide spray (captan, myclobutanil, or propiconazole)
Remove and destroy infected leaves and fruit
ongoing: Regular fungicide applications during growing season
Monitor weather conditions for infection periods

organic_treatment: Baking soda solution (1 tsp per quart water)
Apple___Apple_scab.economic_impact: Can reduce yield by 50-70% in severe cases
Apple___Apple_scab.favorable_conditions: Cool, wet weather (60-75°F with high humidity)

Apple___Black_rot.description: Fungal disease causing black rot on fruit and leaf spots, can be devastating to apple crops.
symptoms: Brown leaf spots with purple margins

immediate: Remove all infected fruit and branches immediately
Burn or bury infected plant material
ongoing: Regular inspection and removal of infected material

prevention: Remove mummified fruit from trees and ground
Prune out dead and diseased wood
Apple___Black_rot.economic_impact: Can cause 100% fruit loss in severe infections

Tomato___Late_blight.description: Devastating oomycete disease that can destroy entire tomato crops within days under favorable conditions.
symptoms: Water-soaked spots on leaves that turn brown
White fuzzy growth on leaf undersides
Firm, brown rot on green fruit

immediate: Remove and destroy infected plants completely
ongoing: Harvest healthy fruit early if possible

prevention: Use certified disease-free seeds and transplants
Water at soil level, avoid wetting foliage
Apply preventive fungicide sprays in high-risk periods
Remove volunteer potato and tomato plants
organic_treatment: Proper plant spacing and air circulation
Tomato___Late_blight.economic_impact: Can cause 100% crop loss within 1-2 weeks
Tomato___Late_blight.favorable_conditions: Cool, wet weather (60-70°F) with high humidity and leaf wetness

Potato___Late_blight.description: The same pathogen that caused the Irish Potato Famine. Extremely destructive disease of potatoes.

immediate: Harvest healthy tubers before disease spreads

prevention: Hill potatoes properly to protect tubers
Potato___Late_blight.economic_impact: Can destroy entire fields, causing millions in losses
Potato___Late_blight.favorable_conditions: Cool, moist conditions (60-70°F) with high humidity

Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.description: Fungal disease causing elongated lesions on corn leaves, reducing photosynthetic capacity.
symptoms: Premature leaf death in severe cases

immediate: Time applications at early disease onset
ongoing: Consider second fungicide application if needed

prevention: Rotate crops to break disease cycle
Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.economic_impact: Can reduce yields by 10-40% in susceptible varieties
Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.favorable_conditions: Moderate temperatures (65-80°F) with high humidity and leaf wetness

Grape___Black_rot.description: Fungal disease affecting grape leaves, shoots, and fruit, causing significant economic losses.
symptoms: Circular brown spots on leaves with dark borders

immediate: Improve air circulation through canopy management
ongoing: Regular fungicide applications during growing season

prevention: Remove mummified berries from vines and ground
Grape___Black_rot.economic_impact: Can cause 50-100% fruit loss in severe cases
Grape___Black_rot.favorable_conditions: Warm, humid weather with frequent rainfall

Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot.description: Bacterial disease causing spots on leaves and fruit, reducing marketability and yield.
symptoms: Small, dark spots on leaves with yellow halos

ongoing: Continue copper applications as preventive measure

prevention: Use drip irrigation instead of overhead watering
Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot.favorable_conditions: Warm, humid conditions with frequent moisture on leaves

Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.description: Fungal disease causing leaf spots and premature defoliation in strawberries.
symptoms: Small, dark purple spots on leaves
Spots may have white or gray centers
Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.economic_impact: Can reduce yield by 15-30% through defoliation
Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.favorable_conditions: Warm, humid weather with leaf wetness

integrated_pest_management: Monitor weather conditions for disease-favorable periods
Apply fungicides preventively rather than curatively
Use biological control agents when appropriate
organic_approaches: Copper-based fungicides for bacterial and fungal diseases
Neem oil for various fungal diseases
Proper plant spacing and air circulation
Composted organic matter for soil health
environmental_considerations: Follow label instructions for application rates

emergency_contacts.agricultural_extension: Contact your local agricultural extension office
